name: Healthy & Delicious: Couscous with Chickpeas, Tomato, and Edamame
description: I conducted an informal survey on my blog last week, asking readers what kind of inexpensive, healthy recipes they’d like to see more of in the future. Overwhelmingly, they asked for easy main dishes that make good leftovers/office lunches. Convenience...
recipeIngredient: 1 cup fresh or frozen shelled edamame (soybeans)
1 (16-ounce) can chickpeas (garbanzo beans), drained and rinsed
1 cup coarsely chopped green onions (about a bunch)

recipeInstructions.text: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add edamame, red pepper, and garlic; cook 3 minutes, stirring frequently. Stir in 1/2 cup water, basil, chickpeas, and tomatoes; simmer 15 minutes. Add 1 3/4 cups water and salt; bring to a boil. Gradually stir in couscous. Remove from heat; cover and let stand 5 minutes. Stir in onions and feta; toss well.
